channel.title: Hard Drive Lock
channel.description:
I recently found an old laptop lying around and didn't remember the password, so I wiped the HDD and installed Ubuntu on it. The problem is, originally when I started the computer up it went to a gray screen asking for a password to unlock the hard drive and it's still doing it despite me formatting the drive. How exactly do I go about removing this screen from Ubuntu?
Edit: Never mind. I got it.

item.title: Hard Drive Lock
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
nunzilla:

Well, this is awkward.

:freeman:

Read full topic

item.title: Hard Drive Lock
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Well the majority of the links I found when I originally searched Google were how to find out the password for the page if you didn’t know it, which I did know the password. I eventually stumbled on a site (where you pay them and they find your password for you) that said all you had to do was go into the BIOS and disable it.

Read full topic
